main event: Multiple incidents of sightings of unidentified aerial objects were reported in various locations including New Mexico in 1948 and 1949. The objects were described as bright white or reddish in color and exhibited slow, vertical descent and explosion at low altitudes.
interesting points: The objects were reported to exhibit slow, vertical descent and explosion at low altitudes, appearing as fiery red fragments descending towards the earth.
A high-ranking military official reported observing a ball of light, reddish white in color, falling vertically, which burst into a spray of red color before reaching the ground.
The sightings occurred at approximately 2200 hours and in the same localities, raising the possibility of a connection between the incidents.
The objects' behavior, such as the slow descent and the lack of noise, was described as unusual, leading observers to dismiss meteorological explanations.
The sightings were not limited to a single witness; military officers, including Colonels and a Lieutenant Colonel, reported observations, adding credibility to the reports.
witnesses: High-ranking military officials, including Colonels and a Lieutenant Colonel
photographs: no, the report does not include photographs
